2SdDjnA1-fWkzfSU9OUEkg.review_text: Pros = Good to eat after a drunken night in the castro, despite long lines you get your food fast, castro special, cheap for slices.  Cons = Bad to eat if you are even remotely sober....in any neighborhood, when you are in a long line you have to wait especially if you are sober after a night of clubbing...you'd much rather be in bed with or without someone. Lastly, and I don't know if being sober is what makes me notice this but.....The guys who serve you seem more rude....is that possible.  Overall I think this is the perfect place to eat when you have consumed mass amounts of liquor....I've even ordered the castro special for a bunch of drunken friends kicking it at my place from the geary location. Liquor + Nizarios Pizza + friends = good times.

f7pSMOZKE3rCReyfjAv_uQ.review_text: I've lived in the Castro for over ten years now but used to visit the Avenues a lot and that is where I first got my taste for Nizario's pizza.  They were always open late and we would stumble there from the bars for some sliced goodness.  I had forgotten that they opened up one near my house in the Castro so I called one day and didn't know what to order so we got the Castro special.  Oh boy, we don't order anything else now.  Nizario's is one of the best and no snobby stoner kids running the registers.

rMNPcAVo5Jpm55Sm68eQ2Q.review_text:
Castro special please!...I heard the hell outta that!  this is where you have to come to get a slice of pizza to bring down the buzz after a night of drinking in the Stro!  Open late most nights.
  Staying home? they deliver too!

pehdkxwE_uW-Bdf2ZxWsug.review_text: The drunken adventures I have to share from this shithole are endless.  Let me just say, kudos for being such smart business owners to stay open until after the bars close... Because this is really the only way and reason they get 99% of their business. Escape from new York around the corner which has WAY better pizza needs to open its eyes and realize they are making the dumbest business decision by closing so early in a neighborhood that breathers and lives during the after hours like Castro!  Nizario's pizza is absolutely gross. Just go during the day and you'll be able to tell why... it is dead. Queens who live in the Castro are sober and know better not to get anywhere near this shoebox hole in the wall during the daylight.  Service here is awful but the poor quality of the overpriced slice of pizza and expired rotten parmesan cheese on the side does it for me.  Alcohol intoxication is not a good enough reason for me to stumble upon this crack house... I must be on either crystal meth or crack to end up here..  Pepperoni pizza: awful Cheese pizza: couldn't be more blend Castro pizza: overpriced and always out  Do they have anything else on their menu? No  STAY AWAY!

clsUcSMUxmlpdcvnVPLeoQ.review_text: Awesome pizza! Cheap reasonable and absolutely delicious!  Damn good when you're drunk.. yum! Just go try it.

rSMTp4LuRd3dQP91AfDUVQ.review_text: Order the Castro Special!  Enough said.  No but really the Castro Special is so delicious! It's a chicken, spinach, and feta cheese pizza.   I came here after a night of drinking with my friends. The pizza was flavorful, fluffy, and perfect amount of crust. Best part was that it wasn't super greasy!

GCuDiPUKYxhgFHP5LqJa2Q.review_text: We love to snack along wherever we are, especially in a neighborhood we have not visited in the past.  After a jerk took our space from behind, we drove around again and eventually found an even better space - that's karma.  Anyway, we were a little hungry but didn't want to commit to anywhere until we see what's available.  Well, a slice of pizza never hurts and we'll be sharing.  There was only one person there and the tv was on.  While we looked, somebody else came in and we let them go first since we were undecided.  We got the vegetarian slice ($3.50).  We waited a few minutes for it to be heated but wish they heated it just another minute or two more.  The crust was crispy and the flavor was good but it was just warm so the cheese didn't pull, which is always the best part.  Anyway, I'm glad they have everything I like to sprinkle on my pizza - garlic powder, pepper flakes, Italian herbs, parmesan cheese and even black pepper.

pkQMZfTnd8O0kP4FA-wogA.review_text: yes yes yes! late, by the slice, delicious specials. I got the castro special. It was SO good. thin but not too crispy crust. Hot. but not too hot. The pizza I've been searching for the past few weeks, FINALLY was in my mouth. the. best. walking. discovery. ever.

08kuNTVgJ1UUZF7QziNSLw.review_text: Next to Cheese Board Pizza in Berkeley, Nizario's houses my favorite SF pizza.... The Castro Special = Chicken Pesto Cheese (i think it also has spinach). Sober or not, this pizza is to die for (unless youre a vegan or something, then ok).  Everyone I have steered over to this place has become addicted to the Castro Special... I'm hungry now.

r_C9dbTsrHx4bJTUSmfPZw.review_text: I was stumbling around with my two friends, enduring a MAJOR case of the drunchies, and happened upon this. No need to get crappy Denny's or anything of the sort. Long line, yes, but it went very fast. The pizza slice was so good that I had a second one, then proceeded to inhale it while hanging around outside and talking to other drunks. I'll have to come back when I'm sober... or will I? To be continued.

uDYNXKTd_cixNNfsyWg57Q.review_text: The Castro slice is so good!  Chicken, feta, & pesto...yum!  The crust was pretty crispy.    This location is kinda small...just a few tables and counter space.  Good for a quick bite.

7rZRJ39tnQJmM3qRJI-zPg.review_text: These clowns need a geography lesson.  Apparently they don't deliver to the Duboce Park area which is no more than 15 minutes walk away from their store.  They told us to order from the Geary store which is 2.5 miles away.  When we called Geary, they quickly sent us back to this store.  When we spoke to the same guy again he said "uh - i just got here".

xWmGF0FR454IyoinQT0ciA.review_text: Hands down best pizza I have ever tasted, great for after the bars any night of the week.

gLke-4oih1t7urvoQAENcQ.review_text: I know it's like the ritual place to go since it's right by Badlands, Toad Hall, and the Mix, but honestly Escape from New York blows this place out of the water. The pizza crust here is way drier than it should be and the crust/topping ratio is off. Always a fat line too.

TEKb4zOkXW3YWjrpaPim6Q.review_text: I think that in the Castro you're divided in 2 pizza camps: Nizario's or Escape from New York.  My vote is for Nizario's.  Although they're never the friendliest at this pizza palor, you truly can't beat one of their slices  (especially late night after a evening full of drinking)!

lGNr8HxAbHfdHQr5Zs5GGA.review_text: two stars for delivering after 1 am.  0 stars for pizza.

VgMS2eqBsxf6rxZIdgBqzQ.review_text: This place is a joke... the pizza is ok but the service is trash!! customer service goes a long way... and the mexican/ latin guy the have preparing the pizza is nasty... he eats food, touches on everything, touches his hair, then touches your food with his bare nasty hands... very unsanitary this is a health issue... God knows what he is putting in the food... the health department meeds to be called there are so many violations going on in this place... if I could give no star I would

O9uxbf6uADlls0qKcVMDwA.review_text: When it's 2am, and you've just left the club and are still kind of drunk, it's delicious. In retrospect, I realized it was kind of pricey. It was really good pizza, I'm just not sure if it was worth 4 dollars a slice.  It was cool that the huge line formed after we were sitting enjoying our pizza, but that was just pure luck.

7lzBryLgYEnQjSVkOtWZqw.review_text: Great to eat after hours , fast service..good staff too. No bathroom as far as I know about it.

isBwyi6IcrotFDPjAG-MkQ.review_text: Oh this place is awesome, workers are very friendly, now when i go to this pizza place i always feel special wahahah but anyways they serve food very fast and very affordable. And here is the deal they have a rest room heheh so I reccomend this pizza place for everyone....

-9lPrsNaYcsDT6LlLhr9TQ.review_text: i have to say this is some good ass pizza by the slice...love the GREKO but it make's your breath hummen and crackn there aint no gum or mouth wash that will help you to get laid that night lol

cNkOnQxtoPmyAerDB6tFHQ.review_text: I went to have a pizza at nazario's on a busy night. A pizza bouncer was filtering the people inside of the place. He was overwhelmed and rude pushing people. The pizza slide was reasonable. Too much cheese and not cooked enough.

o_Grh1LXeVHITZf-0ZIK3A.review_text: After nearly 3 months in SF and not having a single good slice, I'm on a quest to find a slice that would be considered 'good' in NYC. First stop, Nizario's.  The joint itself is nothing special (though it doesn't need to be) with limited seating and one counter. They only offer a few types of slices, including a Castro Special. Generally I like a smaller selection, which implies mastery of those items.  I got a slice of mushroom, and was generally underwhelmed. The crust is french-bread style and the sauces/cheese was not memorable. The slice also wasn't re-heated to a good temperature, so it was cool by the time I finished.   Won't be returning, onto the next place.

QYUNetsQHuSapDl3ceJ2Wg.review_text: so this IS related to the Nizario's on Geary.  I always wondered.  They seemed too alike to not be related.  Anyway, yes, good basic choices, cheap, and FAST.  And there are always 3 dudes standing around at the register like the one on Geary, too.  This is basically a Castro version of the Geary NIzario's --- here, you'll find they play house music over the speakers, and they have a TV that plays movies that may possibly have a GLTB theme.    Just like the other Nizario's, this place has a giant mirrored wall on one side -- so you can drunkenly observe yourself and everyone else chowing down late at night.  Hot mess.  Love it.   This place could stand to have way more chairs and maybe one or two more tables.

RFTVBFlgM0cqvl1daywfjQ.review_text: I'm gonna be honest when I say that I've only ever been here when extremely drunk, but who cares? Each and every time was memorable, and their Greko pizza is love, I can keep eating and eating... I've been meaning to go when sober, but then it may lose it's appeal.

VJHeIGEWeUEnnmDn6k3IXg.review_text: Nizario's is "Old Reliable"... always great slices of pizza (my favorite is The Castro Pizza) and open 'till late.  The style of pizza they serve definitely isn't Neapolitan, Chicago nor New York.  I guess they're better described as, for lack of a better description, "Castro Style".  The crust is technically a thin crust, but a bit on the thicker, breadier side.  The ingredients are top notch and the cheese doesn't run oily at all (a sign of good quality).  You know you just had a good slice of pizza when your paper plate isn't completely transparent at the end of the meal.

R5lhVvcJ7tNx9-Pe2-j8Pg.review_text: A night of hella drinking and dancing in the Castro always ends with me at Nizario's eating hella pizza.   I love Nizario's. The Castro Special is definitely my favorite. Spinach, chicken and pesto never tasted so good (while drunk).  I love the crust, and I feel the amount of sauce and cheese is perfect.  This is such a dangerous place. First of all, I always manage to get too drunk when I'm in the Castro, and as soon as I see Nizario's I end up eating too much pizza, resulting in a very shitty morning.    I do have to admit my favorite thing about this place is the music. They're ALWAYS bumping some crazy ass house, techno and electro. The music here is better than at most of the clubs. I can't help but dance if I'm eating inside.   Oh, and if you're chilling at the Mix across the street, feel free to go across the street, get a slice of pizza and eat it at the Mix.

8Z9ugoA4MGwiJVh-CB8bhQ.review_text: Both times my slices were fresh from the oven. I waited a bit as he was preparing the new pizza but the wait was worth it and quicker than I anticipated.   Pizzas by the slice is always great. Especially when you get the craving and the idea of ordering a whole pizza seems overwhelming because no one is there to share the pie with you.   The pizza is thicker than Marcello's which is more of the floppier NY style but I liked Nizario's crustier slices.   Stays opened LATE which is nice in a city where most everything closes up shop by 10-11pm.

qsPY-gad9ZN4_CaOf--RkA.review_text: CASTRO SPECIAL.    the perfect nightcap to hours of dancing your ass off.  the end.

7HOBCw1pTaZU5qcqwwNy3w.review_text: Visiting family and in town for a couple days  Stopped by here on the way back to the hotel. Really good pizza and cheap too (considering how expensive SF is). Tried the pesto and pepperoni pizza. LOVED the pesto, wish there was a place in Vegas that had it. Great hole-in-the-wall vibe with partiers from the neighboring bars coming over to grab a slice. If I lived here I would be back often.

Hum8GWIBL9jOXWmwFgQghA.review_text: Best. Pizza. Ever. ... or at least my favourite. Always the place to go after all the bars close. The night is over once you have a slice of the The Castro Special... a night without it gives you the hangover, not the alcohol. You might have to dance a couple of hours beforehand to prepare for the calories, but who cares... it's like coke for your mouth... but it's not something you need rehab for (cuz I said: "no, no, no").

NXEb4010qAiLVEZj02PDGw.review_text: If you get drunk in Castro on a Fri/Sat night, your inner compass will point you towards Nizario's.  These guys get put through the ringer with people being MESSY so try to be nice to them when you go.    Good pepporoni pizza...avoid the hawaiian though.  Too many of my friends have gotten the runs from eating it. Not sure why.  Nizarios is also a good place to pull yourself together before going home (either alone or with that special friend you made an hour prior...the insanely bright lights can snap you back to reality).

9cZhf2e7TVQ9S5PC9itvzw.review_text: Shortly after moving here from NY, I went bar hopping in the Castro with a friend who had moved here from NY less than a year prior.  When we left the last bar sometime after 1 am he turned to me and said "Ok.  Now is when all the boys head over to Nizario's for a slice.  Their pizza's really good.  Just like home.  You'll like it."  Cool.  So we head over and get in line with hundreds of other homos needing a slice or two soak up the alcohol in our bellies.   After the first bite I turned to my friend and said, "When was the last time you were home?  This doesn't taste anything like New York."  Basically, the dough is just really thick.    But, no, I am not going to write another "why can't anyone make NY style pizza in SF?" review.  I've given up and accepted it.  And its all good.  The same friend who introduced me to Nizario's also taught me this valuable lesson, "Jeff, this is not New York and its never going to be New York.  So, the sooner you accept it, the happier you are going to be here."  He was so right.  And, now, I love it here in San Francisco and  no longer expect to find NY pizza here (although I feel that Arinell & Marcello's are the closest).  And, that's okay.  What I do love about Nizario's is that their pepperoni is usually well done, just like I like it.

k3HW9bpJujFi8bdj2NFYBQ.review_text: This place use to get 4 stars because it use to be open till 3 on weekends and 2 on weekdays, hence between 2-3 am on weekends it would  turn into club nizarios, and id always stumble home at the end of the night with a good story.  I haven't been back as much since they changed times, but they serve up a decent slice of pizza (ive been spoiled by NYC visits sadly). If you're in the neighborhood and craving pizza, this is the place to go....try the cheese/castro special.

S3gNrUh7N9oWoackKlHGMQ.review_text: Because I try not to eat solid foods on weekends, I only ever end up eating the pizza here when I'm drunk.  I do enjoy the Castro Special!  The Castro IS special!  Special!  Special!  YAY!!!

dWeyBRKKcoY0pWqhwzXiGg.review_text: There is no better pizza then the Castro Special.  I will come here all the way from Oakland just to get my fix.  AND for entertainment purposes this is the place you will find all the skinny gays shovel food in their face at the end of a long night.  Gaurantee you will find all these skinny bitches eating like it was their last meal at 2am.  lol  It's definitely a site to see :)

AO21iJAApF7mIfB6YetjOA.review_text: best pizza in the castro, by far!  maybe best in the city after goat hill.

u8N1deNIiTm-dLJKf7oVDw.review_text: Alright, the pizza is mediocre at best. I have definitely come here several times because my friend lives a couple of doors down and when you've had a few adult beverages, convenience is key. Meh...it's okay.

CDap0lATTsXsRzTe7HYK-g.review_text: It was ok.   It is a very bready pizza without much sauce--not really my fav.   The pizza was also quite late. I was starving by the time it got here, but it still didn't make it a great pizza.

ggl6fl-PM5O1WrdReL0l4A.review_text: Stop by for a slice of drunk pizza on a Thursday night. This slice was different than the ones I usually find in New England. It wasn't quite thick crust but wasn't thin either. Solid slice if you are in the area.

eOVZKDzyFMDKWJnI45oWOg.review_text: Really? 4 stars? I guess drunkies like anything you put in their mouths. Pizza here is A-okay. Wayyyy too oily for me. I 've soaked 4 napkins of oil from a slice of pizza.... I just ran out of napkins to soak some more.

x5VNOhKG-h7kraIPjwnAfw.review_text: Two words: Castro pizza. Yes please!  Okay so I guess more like four words.   This was the perfect end after a night of dancing at The Cafe. My friends got the Hawaiian pizza which was also pretty amazing. There weren't any chairs inside the restaurant and I didn't like the idea of standing after my feet were dying from my shoes, but i got over the pain pretty quickly cause the pizza was just that darn good.

GmqtrGT0VJV6vdicmy-qdA.review_text: I like the fact that it's open really late on any given night. The only pizza I would recommend here is the "Castro" pizza. If you want anything else, I'd recommend another pizzeria somewhere else.

Rl0dFlPpZCE0s7uOxJMEOg.review_text: Pizza pizza pizza pizzzzaaa awwwwyeah.  Despite the fact that I had already eaten dinner that night, my friends convinced me to indulge in some pre-drinking foodies. I just can't say no to pizza. Especially not Nizarios.  Mmm pesto.  And they have more than just the typical cheese and red pepper shaker.  They have garlic!  Noms.  Perfect thing to avoid drankin on an empty stomach, and also conveniently within stumbling distance of the bars of the 'stro for when you're not in the mood for a dirty dog at the end of the night.

dP2vQRFB0xK5bD-aCGZM1w.review_text: so good after a crazy night out...one slice is all you need. =)

Z4Fkz0ET2vqvjr-Cijo9Tg.review_text: I don't know what it is about you Nazario's...I wish I could quit you. I really wish I could.  Actually, I don't. I love you too much. Always quick and tasty. Love me a Castro Special. And when I feel sassy, I'll add a slice of Greek pizza and have that. And once, when I was REALLY sassy (more like a fat-ass) I added a cheese slice to all that.  Pretty good pizza, always friendly folks. Never had any complaints with this place. :)

9Bq09meTAggWpjIsier7iQ.review_text: Not bad, and it's open way late which is great for the clubbers out in the neighborhood! The pizza was not bad, I had the Castro Special, definitely better with some alcohol on board.   Not a ton of seating, but it's great that you can take a slice, stuff it in your face, and head back out!

IH1iOatR3UkGxuiZVD4Xqg.review_text: It's a pizza slice place, y'know? Kinda dirty, next to Midnight Sun. The Castro slice is the way to go. They are fast. The crust is on the thicker side. I think it rates up there with Marcello's. One slice will be enough.

0gEDwhSUIWIBz23MbLYMig.review_text: After the salty craving and after the sweet craving there is the *I durno but I just want to keep eating* craving.  Pizza was the food item of choice.  Our first choice, Little Star on Divisadero, was closed!  The runner up, Patxi's Chicago Pizza...CLOSED ALSO!  Oh lordy lordy.  And so it was that we ended up at Nizario's.  There is nothing wrong with Nizario's Pizza.  Nothing at all.  It's good pizza.  I mean, much like a blowjob, pizza can never be that bad even when it doesn't make your toes curl and eyes roll back into your head...

u6h6xb9_F8zWxQZfH14cKA.review_text: Best Late Night Pizza Ever!!!! I heart their Castro Special.  It's their signature with pesto, feta, spinach, and chicken.  It is delicious.  I've tried their other toppings, but the castro special is truly something unique.

iF-Nz3c7ickNeCBx0Ha8mA.review_text: Once I was drunk at Tacoria Cancon in the mission, and hopped a cab all the way to Nizarios for a slice.  I have a problem. I am in love with a pizza place. How am I going to break it to my parents?

yR-6YxGdgNJTBfJtQ5CmRw.review_text: I love this pizza when I am in the area. This place stays open late and is located in a busy area of the Castro.This place is very small if you plan on wanting a sit down probably not the best place, although there are two small bar tables inside. The guy in at the registar is usually nice, I am sure he has to deal with a lot of drunks and partiers at 1am from the local bars there. When I am in the mood for pizza after a night out I make my way here to Nazario's. I have been to the Geary location and did not like the pizza there nor the service. Hey it's open late night and they have decent pizza for both when your drinking or not.

xp4qD7Ol1vsS3BQdLwPMnw.review_text: The best pizza I've ever eaten. I drive all the way from the east bay just to eat here. Love their hawaiian pizza.

00xij_Pk8lDzaMubY7AxSQ.review_text: The go to pizza!  The Castro special is quite possibly one of my favorite pizzas!  Always consistent! Tons of spinach, pesto, feta, chicken, not too much cheese, solid crust! Open late,  free delivery!  Yum!

4Wgn81oVidD4puNDiqqN9A.review_text: My stomach is growling just thinking about this place!! You gotta try the CASTRO SPECIAL!! Its a small little pizza joint not the cleanest place...but decent enough..the pizza is well worth it! Good place to go to after a night of dancing and drinkin!!

g8yxr3YCpoqK17n5gGjhFw.review_text: great pizza by the slice!   I've lived in SF off and on since 1998.  Mostly in Castro and Haight so I've had my share of pizza by the slice places.  This is one of the best!  Def a fav of mine.  Open late.  Doesn't take long even when the line goes out the door!

76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg.review_text: 3.5 stars but rounding down since they did NOT have sausage pizza available.. in the CASTRO!! However, the slice of Cheese Pizza ($3) I had was good- nice and cheesy, and still so hot it burned my mouth a bit despite giving it time to cool off. Service was also super quick. There are a few counter seats available inside, and plenty of sidewalk space to stand outside and eat as well.   Overall, a good spot to go after drinking in the Castro, but they need to add a sausage option! Parking is difficult in this area, but street parking is available.

eSdQJJx3s-4uKS9ofr0zhw.review_text: I love you Nizaro's.  After a fancy shamncy meal across the street at Poesia.. in which I was not fully satisfied.  I ordered a slice of the veggie pizza to go.  The husband ordered a plain cheese.  It totally hit the spot.  It was only $6.25 for both slices..   The pizza at Nizaro's has the perfect amount of cheese, sauce, toppings and bread/crust.  If I could choose, I would guess Nizaro's would be better then Seniore's possibly because its healthier; less crust = less calories?  Not sure hahahaa.. but I'd pick Nizaro's regardless.  It was pretty tasty.

Q2Iest8oggBub6nVBFEcNw.review_text: Castro has no shortage of grab'n'go pizza places, that's for sure.  Methinks it may have to do with providing fuel for the bargoers (the fact that Nizario's hours are 3 PM - 2 AM is another clue).  Of course, I'm unlikely to be drinking the night away in these parts anytime soon, so I stopped in on a weekend afternoon instead.  And boy is this place barebones, even by the standards of its kind (3 2-stool tables and a standing-only counter).  So while I prefer to eat sitting down, I think you'll really enjoy the pizza more while strolling down some victorian-lined street nearby.    But anyway, the important thing is the pizza itself.  First, kudos on the Castro Special--a chicken-pesto pizza that doesn't overdo it on the pesto.  Crust could've been pillowier, though.  Oh yeah, and it needed to be hotter.  Overall, it beats Marcello's but not Escape From New York, although if I'm going to EFNY might as well go to the Haight.  The real question is whether the Richmond Nizario's is any different--it's farther from home, but some of the reviews suggest the quality is better, and at any rate I'm far more likely to drunkenly stumble by it some night.

sslHnbTuz4wuzmr9wfHBaQ.review_text: Not sure what changed but I won't be coming here anymore. Was there an ownership change ?  Staff is different and not friendly. Never have the slices I want and  it doesn't taste as good. Good thing there are other options.

B-mbvdc8jAGMRJEJ088rzQ.review_text: I was drunk and it was OK.  Marcello's and dare I say it Escape from NY are better.

bUgnpT487CPh3v2QUViAUg.review_text: It's a perfect place to get some pizza after leaving the bars on Castro late at night. Try the "Castro Special", you will not forget to order it again next time. Frindly staff; no snobby guys assisting you like the other pizzerias around the neighborhood.

vXrUBAIN4aoCt7F5p0kU_g.review_text: This place is open almost like a 7-11.  I have no clue what time they close down?  But after going to the bars, my friends wanted to come here to have the pizza soak up the booze action.  Prices were about $2.75 and up per slice.  But I didn't think the pizza was all that great.  Kind of bland.  Oh well, good to know if you need to grab a bite to eat after getting your drink on in the Castro.  Ca$h only!

qkelo15wZAzyC_lPB5ODkQ.review_text: The pizza here is great! I had the Castro slice and it was very flavorful and greasy. I'm sure this place gets very busy during after hours.

pWl131xflJTixSc-q4tPZQ.review_text: We used to like Nizario's.  A lot.  Then they got rid of the combo that we liked the best, but worse yet they cut back on their pepperoni.  Nizario's is not the only guilty party here unfortunately.  Would it kill the 3 by-the-slice pizzerias in the Castro to put more than a hint of pepperoni on their pepperoni slices?  It's like a race to the bottom - each has less pepperoni per slice than the others.  I don't know yet if this is a San Francisco-wide phenomenon, or just collusion by the Castro by-the-slice pizzerias in wringing the last few pennies out of the Castro partiers and ignoring the people who live in the area who would gladly pay more to frequent a local establishment that puts more than just a courtesy dash of pepperoni on their individual slices.

26M4SlyVW9RCXuoWH8xJgg.review_text: Ah yeah, pizza fan I am! There is nothing like a nice fat slice of pizza late at night after an evening of alcohol and music. Short and simply put, the crust was perfection: thick and doughy with a crisp crunch on the outside. The cheese ever so melty and gooey and what else can I say except I took that slice all the way into the emergency room, that the check in nurse looked at me all crazy. Yes, it was that good. About the e.r., that's ahem... another blog.

PadmV2GEoA6mWpQUpPh7Ig.review_text: For some reason..... Their greasy, big slice of pizza was suuuuuper duuuuper good after shots ot tequila. Yes.  My friend got a pepperoni, and i took a bite. I had no intentions of getting my own..but after that bite....i walked up to the counter right away and got my own slice of cheese pizza.  It was good. And cheap.

kf09a_ZEHAUNfj5eymRoVg.review_text: Delicious, open really late, kind of greasy but just the right amount, cheap and always an interesting crowd to watch -- what is not to like? afterhours pizza was made for Nizario's.

0K2eqWTbS-YevwvlJXTUzA.review_text: OK . So walking into this place at 1 am with my Good friend Georgie after a crazy night on the Castro .. I have discovered one of the BEST slice of Pizza Ive ever Ate!!!  I ordered a CASTRO only in thru Frisco Fashion  and It was EFFIN perfect !  Sprinkled a lil Cheese and a lil Pepper and Bada Bing Bada boom!  It has Pesto Chicken and spinich and Hella cheese !  most defiantly going back REAL SOoOon! payed 9 bux 4 two Slices and 2 drinks Over all Very cheap!

CNw5B3BBhTbOlrOlS1meEA.review_text: This is the best pizza in the neighborhood even if you're not a drunk.

fVUQ985lDk6CDYMYioi7cw.review_text: A great little hole in the wall pizza joint.  Fresh slices always ready and never more than a 2 minute wait.  Friendly staff and they are open hella late.

b1TLsiRhQdfbbXahqFkVtg.review_text: In the business world there is a saying:  "Good, Fast, Cheap.  Pick two"  Nizario's is fast and cheap.  I'll let you all figure it out.

Nj52Bnbar3NzZ10cgQnvWQ.review_text: If I could live anywhere in the world, it would be the Castro... at Nizario's Pizza!  This place is delicious and the guy who I order pizza from is always so nice and sweet.  The cheese pizza is good, but don't feel afraid to try their specials - I've had them before and they're pretty good.   Best to have when drunk. The grease and alcohol in your belly makes for a good combination.

1UvbpnVORMOEm4LJ194lMw.review_text: Ohhhh ,I can not pass by without going in & getting a slice of pizza, delicious ,,,great staff good service.

fyTNJNGgCgn2fH3Tvr-YaQ.review_text: I love the pizza here but the fact that the middle eastern dude keeps looking at me like s piece of meat...fuck himn

M0qZtwB55-0NsO805CHBrg.review_text: I love this place!!! Was there at 1am still open. Pizza was hot and fresh.  Not many tables inside but that's ok I don't mind the fresh pizza scent :)

R6oLlIqXNjcwZVwNzSwp1Q.review_text: Just moved back to the city and all I can say is "YUM"  Many times has this little joint been the after party of the midnight hour.  And after enough trips to the front of the line, i already know the drill... "Castro Special!" So Good, perhaps not the healthiest, but at that time of night, it's not like anyone is looking to watch their waist line. I'm a Fan!

frkxMUXg5xqGDPNZ8SaZjQ.review_text: This is one of my favorite pizza places in San Francisco, which is saying nothing since the pizza is so bad in this town.  My girlfriend says that it reminds her of the pizza you got in middle school.  I kind of like it though.

gBKyfG3Po3ZonmPv6ILldQ.review_text: what is delicious when you're stumbling drunk after a night of drinking and in search of something to coat your stomach and slow the absorption of alcohol does NOT translate to delicious, quality pizza when you're ordering for a party of 8.   i paid $43 for two large pizzas that you could easily count the sparse amount of toppings. i won't be making this mistake again.

Rihux4oGUzOq3LoCKwkgXw.review_text: I wont repeat what everyone else has said about this place as I concur, but this place is also good delivery!  For those who like one slice, imagine a couple large ones for a party.  SO goood!  Sometimes I wish I were sober when I eat there because then my taste buds would actually work!  Castro special all the way.

DZmO1K9s8ZaDiX1UHA8FwQ.review_text: Slices in house are tasty-I ordered a family size super combo last night and recieved it within 15 min.- I tipped the driver $4.50 paid $28.50 for the pizza and ended up throwing away most of it. nothing like the in house. I will never order or go back to this pizza store!

Gl0F_kAfOamLtquy7P1hdg.review_text: I went there sober the other night for the first time and the pizza was STILL wonderful.  Also, the guy who works at the register said "it's nice to see you again" which i guess makes me a regular, and I'm totally into being a regular at a hole-in-the-wall pizza place.  However, one night last week some friends and I ordered a pizza for delivery and there was way too much sauce for my taste.

RFFPYEMmjWSyXgjVYU2kDw.review_text: 45 minutes exactly for delivery! At least for the past five years. Great group of real Earthy San Francisco style people running the joint. Nizario's Pizza is the place to be after the ugly lights come on in the Castro and alcohol has stopped flowing. Castro special is truly special.

_50qkmXiYpTILxH6gh4hOg.review_text: After a few drinks this place is perfect!  Awesome hot pizza and very reasonable.  Try the Castro Special Pesto pizza. It's Awesome!

q6J0RrdafRqkxR_ffONHcQ.review_text: Not much selection, but the pizza is good for the price. The Castro Special is probably the best thing to get, other than that the pizza is OK. Not somethig i would go out of my way for.

v1UYVpOeiMd4wWgD1Fu0Fw.review_text: nizario's vs. marcello's.  the never ending battle of "best pizza place in castro." (i'm not even acknowledging escape from new york. sorry guys.)  while this debate may never be settled, i personally have always preferred nizzy's. they just have better crust, toppings and marinara sauce. period period. and nothing in the area compares to nizzy's castro special.  now, if only i still allowed myself to eat carbs...

BVKJF0OYYy9uqOEmEL37bw.review_text: I think I've been here...really...I mean, there are many fuzzy recollections of me walking through the doors...then leaving feeling totally full and happy.  I think I remember ordering the Castro Pizza...I think it was really good.

DObB0OeZFzTsYGpoB8ohQA.review_text: My search for good pizza in San Francisco continued at Nizario's, but alas has not ended at Nizario's.  Far and above Marcello's with a passable pizza crust and good topping combinations.  However they load up on the cheese, skimp on flavor in the sauce and just seem to be missing something else.  If memory serves, they also have a TV and that's a definite "No No" in my pizza prize criteria.

uQ4ukgdAE2Eg-IKwhUNMiw.review_text: First off I will preface this with saying the only way to truly enjoy this pizza is when you are bombed and I have only had Nizario's when on booze control. I am afraid to try it when sober because I have a feeling I will realize that it really isn't that good and in fact might suck. So to prevent that from happening I will stick to my stopping by while drinking. So when in the Castro and drinking and you need a slice to help with the hangover looming on the horizon it is highly recommended. The service their is very appropriate for the neighborhood get-in get-out with a hot sticky something in between... the pizza silly

XD7g8XBBWEqk-m9eaUog2Q.review_text: Suffice it to say, the majority of my experience with this place has been when I'm completely hammered off my ass. And every time I come, I have to wade through the sea other other drunkards only to stumble up to the counter and have the dilemma of my life in choosing what type of pizza I want. What I think is great about this place is that no matter what, they will always heat your pizza for you. This is in stark contrast to Pizza Orgasmica, where you have wait in an endless line in a super hot entry way only to be served a thin, cold slice of pizza where the cheese oils have created a congealed layer of disgustingness. (Side note I don't understand why every one raves about that place; the pizza is pretty crappy, particularly if you've had to endure the throngs of drunk, obnoxious Marina-ites in their infinite line). Nizario's is fast, their dough is good (doughy in the middle, slightly crisp on the bottom) and their prices are quite average, which is fine.   Now, I thought that this was simply a drunken revelation; warm, gooey pizza is always delicious when wasted. However, last night, I was shown that this place is pretty damn good sober. Maybe it was because I was starving and had had a really shitty day, but nevertheless, it was yum. And, for the first time in my experience, it was empty. I guess all the drunks were waiting until later to invade(although, it was already near 10). Try the Castro special: spinach, feta, chicken, and pesto. mmmmm. Or the super combo, which basically has everything on it. I'm not saying this is the best pizza in the world, but it hits the spot when you need it. Major plus: the people working there are super friendly, even when you're near belligerent.

qhGUtlMKxDkiNHg0xkkj3g.review_text: i'm drunk...and just had their combo slice.  FIVE stars.  greasy, salty, tasty, cheesy, and perfection.  I'm drunk.

4yPN4zgIGTtOT9EHXscEvg.review_text: I love Nizario's Pizza Drunk, Sober, I love it! always yummy I've never had anything to complain about, well except for maybe the employees their not exactly "friendly" but then again they're also usually a little to busy to be up and personal with customers. I never really sat down and ate IN Nizario's, but during the day looks like they have a few places to sit and eat, night time always to crowded to tell, but loooove the pizza!

8FfjI-7L7lXYYL19mwV9IQ.review_text: Castro pizza is a very personal thing. Between Marcello's, Escape from NY and Nizario's, everyone has their favorite. (Guess which one isn't mine?)  Most of us eat it when we're blitzed in the wee hours of the morning, and Nizario's has the benefit (or rather, the strategy) of being open later than most. I've been here many times, and while the pizza is decent, it just isn't my favorite in the 'hood. The crust is so doughy, and the per-slice price isn't really that great of a deal.   Four drinks in I'll eat here in a pinch, but at that point it's not really about getting great pizza, is it?
